meanings.definition: In a manner that shows irritation or impatience
meanings.sent1: She responded testily when asked to wait in line.
meanings.sent2: He always speaks testily when he's in a bad mood.
meanings.sent3: The cat meowed testily when its toy was taken away.
meanings.sent4: The old car engine sputtered testily before finally starting.
meanings.sent5: The teacher looked testily at the students who were talking during the lesson.

meanings.definition: To speak or act in an irritable or impatient manner
meanings.sent1: He tends to testily argue with his siblings over small things.
meanings.sent2: She testily told him to stop interrupting her while she was working.
meanings.sent3: The chef testily tossed the burnt dish into the trash.
meanings.sent4: The wind testily whipped through the trees, causing the leaves to rustle loudly.
meanings.sent5: The toddler testily refused to eat his vegetables, crossing his arms in defiance.
